title: Data100: Project B2 — Spam Email Classification
desc: Built a machine learning pipeline to classify emails as spam or not spam using real-world text data. Loaded and cleaned a dataset of 8,000+ labeled emails, engineered features from email subjects and bodies, and trained models to distinguish spam from ham. Explored text preprocessing, feature engineering, and model selection to maximize classification accuracy.
shortDesc: Classified emails as spam or not spam using machine learning on real-world text data.

title: CS162 Group — Pintos
desc: Extended the Pintos operating system by implementing a full-featured file system and buffer cache. Managed disk storage at the byte level, added support for file system syscalls, and optimized disk access with a custom buffer cache. Hands-on experience with systems programming, synchronization, and persistent storage.
shortDesc: Extended Pintos OS with a file system and buffer cache for CS162.

title: 61B — BYOB Project (proj3)
desc: CS61B capstone project: designed and built a large-scale, deterministic Java game called 'Build Your Own World' (BYOW). Implemented procedural world generation, interactive main menu, avatar movement, saving/loading, and custom ambition features. Emphasized software engineering best practices, modular design, and reproducibility.
shortDesc: Designed and built a large-scale Java game for CS61B.

title: Computer Vision DeCal: Zero-Shot CLIP
desc: Explored zero-shot image classification using OpenAI’s CLIP model and the CIFAR-10 dataset. Implemented a pipeline to generate zero-shot classifier weights from text templates, evaluated top-1 and top-5 accuracy, and visualized predictions. Demonstrated the power of vision-language models for classifying images without explicit training on target classes.
shortDesc: Used OpenAI CLIP for zero-shot image classification on CIFAR-10.
